content.eamr: ( ing-0 "2 eggs" )
( ing-1 "1/4 cup water" )
( ing-2 "6 tablespoons all-purpose flour" )
( ing-3 "1/2 teaspoon salt" )
( ing-4 "2 tablespoons chopped onion" )
( ing-5 "1 tablespoon butter" )
( ing-6 "1 tablespoon all-purpose flour" )
( ing-7 "1 cup milk" )
( ing-8 "1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese, divided" )
( ing-9 "1 1/2 teaspoons Dijon mustard" )
( ing-10 "1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce" )
( ing-11 "1/4 teaspoon pepper" )
( ing-12 "1/8 teaspoon salt" )
( ing-13 "2 cups frozen chopped broccoli, thawed" )

content.text: 0) For batter, combine the eggs, water, flour and salt in a blender.
content.eamr:
( inst-0 / R
	:inform ( ac-0-0 "combine"@15:22 / AC
		:subtask ( purp-0-0 "For batter"@3:13 / PURPOSE_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( ing-0 "the eggs"@23:31 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-1 "water"@33:38 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-2 "flour"@40:45 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-3 "salt"@50:54 / FOOD )
		:loc ( tool-0-0 "a blender"@58:67 / TOOL )
	)
)

content.text: 1) Cover and process until smooth; let stand for 15 minutes.
2) Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender.
content.eamr:
( inst-2 / R
	:inform ( ac-2-0 "saute"@35:40 / AC
		:loc ( tool-2-0 "a small saucepan"@17:33 / TOOL )
		:ppt ( ing-4 "onion"@41:46 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-5 "butter"@50:56 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-2-0 "until tender"@57:69 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)

( inst-3 / R
	:inform ( ac-3-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-6 "flour"@11:16 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-3-0 "until blended"@17:30 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 5) Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until slightly thickened.
content.eamr:
( inst-5 / R
	:inform ( ac-5-0 "boil"@14:18 / AC
		:heat ( temp-5-0 "medium heat"@24:35 / TEMPERATURE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:simultaneous ( ac-5-1 "stirring"@37:45 / AC )
	)
	:inform ( ac-5-2 "cook and stir"@58:71 / AC
		:duration ( dur-5-0 "2 minutes"@76:85 / DUR )
		:until ( cond-5-0 "until slightly thickened"@89:113 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 7) Stir in 1/2 cup cheese, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, pepper and salt until cheese is melted.
content.eamr:
( inst-7 / R
	:inform ( ac-7-0 "Stir in"@3:10 / AC
		:ppt ( ing-8 "1/2 cup cheese"@11:25 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-9 "mustard"@27:34 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-10 "Worcestershire sauce"@36:56 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-11 "pepper"@58:64 / FOOD )
		:ppt ( ing-12 "salt"@69:73 / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-7-0 "until cheese is melted"@74:96 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
	)
)

content.text: 10) Heat a lightly greased 8-in. nonstick skillet; pour 2 tablespoons batter into the center of skillet.
11) Lift and tilt pan to evenly coat bottom.
12) Cook until top appears dry; turn and cook 15-20 seconds longer.
14) Repeat with remaining batter, greasing skillet as needed.
15) Spoon about 1/2 cup filling down the center of each crepe; roll up.
16) Place seam side down in an ungreased 11-in. baking dish.
18) Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F for 5-7 minutes or until cheese is melted.
content.eamr:
( inst-18 / R
	:inform ( ac-18-0 "Bake"@4:8 / AC
		:heat ( temp-18-0 "350 degrees F"@24:37 / TEMPERATURE )
		:duration ( dur-18-0 "5-7 minutes"@42:53 / DUR )
		:ppt ( NULL / FOOD )
		:until ( cond-18-0 "until cheese is melted"@57:79 / CONDITION_CLAUSE )
	)
)
